com.apigee.flow.execution.spi
Interface Execution

public interface Execution

 A single unit of execution in the flow of a message (either
 in the request path or the response path). The execute() method
 will be invoked with the MessageContextImpl as an argument.

 Implement this interface and get access to the following data in
 the flow:
   1. request message: This instance can be retrieved using messageContext.getRequestMessage().
         For more details extract specific information from the request see
         com.apigee.flow.message.Message
   2. response message: This instance can be retrieved using messageContext.getResponseMessage().
         For more details extract specific information from the request see
         com.apigee.flow.message.Message
   3. Any information can be added into the flow. The information should be in the
         form of com.apigee.flow.FlowInfo and can be added on to the
         flow as messageContext.getFlow().addFlowInfo(FlowInfo data)
   4. Information can be retrieved from the flow in a similar manner using the method
         messageContext.getFlow().getFlowInfo(String identifier)
   5. Some variables are readily available during the execution and can be retrieved as
         messageContext.getFlow().get("variable-name");
         Entity Names: organization.name, application.name, proxy.name, target.name
         Transport Properties: request.header.{name}, request.queryParam.{name},
               request.verb, request.port, etc
             (similar pattern for response)

Method Summary
 ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext)
           
 

Method Detail

execute

ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext,
                        ExecutionContext executionContext)
Parameters:
messageContext - the context associated with the current flow
executionContext - a handle to control the flow
Returns:
if success, return ExecutionResult.SUCCESS else return the ExecutionResult with appropriate error message and headers.
See Also:
ErrorHandler
